comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:59.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/59.0
Build ID: 20180323154952

Steps to reproduce:

Go to site:
---
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/20279484/how-to-access-the-correct-this-inside-a-callback
---
Mark and copy Question (Yo can ommit the Answers) including comments under the question.
Then paste in "editable content area", e.g. in "Web gmail" or in LibreOffice. The comments are swallowed. Only question is preserved and pasted.


Actual results:

The comments are swallowed. Only question is preserved and pasted.


Expected results:

If I paste the marked and copied text (Question and comments under the question) into clipboard from stackoverflow.com then all the contents: Question including comments should be preserved and pasted in "editable content area" in Web gmail or LibreOffice. Maybe also the formatting. Thank you.
comments.author: vladokoval@pobox.sk

comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:61.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/61.0
Build ID: 20180412001050

Hello Vlado,

I have managed to reproduce this issue on latest Firefox release 59.0.2, latest Nightly build 61.0a1 (2018-04-12), using Windows 10 x64, Mac 10.13.4 and Arch Linux 4.12. I have copied one question along with a comment, and the comment wasn't pasted in the Google Docs or in a LibreOffice Document.

Using the Mozregression tool, I've managed to find a regression-window. Here are the results:
Last good revision: 320642944e42a889db13c6c55b404e32319d4de6
First bad revision: 52285ea5e54c73d3ed824544cef2ee3f195f05e6
Pushlog:https://goo.gl/Rzi7AT

I've ran the Mozregression tool on several testing machines and obtained the same pushlog result.
I am assigning a component to this issue in order to involve the development team and get an opinion on this.

Thanks.
comments.author: cristina.badescu@softvision.ro

comments.text: I can't reproduce.  When I select https://screenshots.firefox.com/2OP19WEh56MkGZyR/stackoverflow.com and copy and paste in a text box, I get https://gist.github.com/ehsan/2a227b53723ad93e987f1c3e0c71d86d.
comments.author: ehsan@mozilla.com

comments.text:
This issue is still reproducible on the latest Firefox 60.0. Indeed, this issue is no longer reproducible on latest Firefox Developer Edition 61.0b6(Build ID: 20180517141400), latest Nightly build 62.0a1 (Build ID: 20180520220103), using Windows 10 x64.

Considering this, I've used the Mozregression tool in order to find the fix. Here are the results:
First good revision: 422aebe40856002e8e53916433703840dc6fafa9
Last bad revision: 28c2803c243aaccac97653e21013450e74f4ef90
Pushlog: https://goo.gl/jvoqg8

It seems that bug 1457026 has fixed this.
Vlado, can you please retest this on latest Nightly 62.0a1 build and see if you can still reproduce the issue?

Thanks.
comments.author: cristina.badescu@softvision.ro

comments.text:
Since the issue was fixed by bug 1457026 and the reporter sent me an e-mail confirming that the issue is no longer reproducible on latest Nightly build 62.0a1, I'm marking this as Resolved-Duplicate.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 1457026 ***
comments.author: cristina.badescu@softvision.ro
